dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2514 IH: Funding for Aviation Screeners and Threat Elimination Restoration Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. DeFazio (for himself, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, and Mrs. Watson Coleman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to ensure that revenues collected from passengers as aviation security fees are used to help finance the costs of aviation security screening by repealing a requirement that a portion of such fees be credited as offsetting receipts and deposited in the general fund of the Treasury.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Funding for Aviation Screeners and Threat Elimination Restoration Act or the FASTER Act.

section.header: Repeal of requirement regarding crediting and deposit of a portion of aviation security fees

subsection.text: Subsection (i) of section 44940 of title 49, United States Code, is repealed.
Subsection (d)(4) of such section is amended by striking , other than subsection (i),.
